intro: Ruizia boutoniana, commonly known as the African flame or flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling flames, which attract pollinators like birds and insects. The plant has compound leaves with long, slender leaflets that are often shed during the dry season. Its woody stems are smooth and can grow up to several meters in height. Ruizia boutoniana is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in challenging climates.
